p.s: The poem Sonnet 138 by William Shakespeare was published in 1609.
It is concerned with the phenomenon of unhonesty in love, as the lyrical I admires his beloved person for the way she is regardless.
The poem's thesis is presented in the first quatrain, being the lyrical I's love insisting that she is truthful.
The speakersspeaker's initial reaction to the thesis is to deny it by indicating what she might be lying about and also why that is.
The second quatrain continues the argument; the speaker judges his beloved person for knowing of his imperfections as for him being old.
He says that because of him being the only one trusting her, he reciprocrates.
The Volta is introduced in the third quatrain, stating the new argument; that love functions like this and the aspects above being the good part of it.
The conclusion mlust rates the acceptance, resulting in a stronger bond between the lyrical I and the beloved person.
